description.para: The set quota command should only be used whenever there is no operating system API available from the OS that samba can use.
This option is only available if Samba was compiled with quota support.
This parameter should specify the path to a script that can set quota for the specified arguments.
The specified script should take the following arguments:

listitem.para: 1 - path to where the quota needs to be set. This needs to be interpreted relative to the current working directory that the script may also check for.

2 - quota type
1 - user quotas
2 - user default quotas (uid = -1)
3 - group quotas
4 - group default quotas (gid = -1)
3 - id (uid for user, gid for group, -1 if N/A)
4 - quota state (0 = disable, 1 = enable, 2 = enable and enforce)

description.para: The script should output at least one line of data on success. And nothing on failure.
